pullRequest.title: Add BIR spec test
pullRequest.bodyText:
Purpose
This PR will add a validation test for BIR binary by reading and comparing it with original BIR model.
Resolves #24774
Approach

Describe how you are implementing the solutions along with the design details.

Samples

Provide high-level details about the samples related to this feature.

Remarks

List any other known issues, related PRs, TODO items, or any other notes related to the PR.

Check List

 Read the Contributing Guide
 Updated Change Log
 Checked Tooling Support (#)
 Added necessary tests

 Unit Tests
 Spec Conformance Tests
 Integration Tests
 Ballerina By Example Tests


 Increased Test Coverage
 Added necessary documentation

 API documentation
 Module documentation in Module.md files
 Ballerina By Examples

commit.message: Add simple BIR spec test to read bir binary and validate

nodes.bodyText: We add license header for test cases as well if I am not mistaken
There seems to be lots of work in validating a very simple bir? Can't we simplify this. I mean some assert function that would validate the expected and the current would be useful.

commit.message: Update BIR spec file with constants & typedef structures
Add utility class to help with testing BIR model
Add constant values BIR test case

commit.message: Update BIR spec with map constant info
Rafactor BIR test utility class and update

nodes.bodyText:
shall we change

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  type_tag:
          
          
            
                    value: _root.constant_pool.constant_pool_entries[constant_value_type_cp_index].cp_info.as<shape_cp_info>.shape.type_tag
          
          
            
                  type:
          
          
            
                    value: _root.constant_pool.constant_pool_entries[constant_value_type_cp_index].cp_info.as<shape_cp_info>
          
      
    
    
  

and above switch-on: type_tag to switch-on: type.shape.type_tag
that way, the parsed model will be more useful for the LLVM team.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -185,6 +198,95 @@ types:
         type: markdown
       - id: type_cp_index
         type: s4
+  type_definition:
+    seq:
+      - id: position
+        type: position
+      - id: name_cp_index
+        type: s4
+      - id: flags
+        type: s4
+      - id: label
+        type: s1
+      - id: doc
+        type: markdown
+      - id: type_cp_index
+        type: s4
+  constant:
+    seq:
+      - id: name_cp_index
+        type: s4
+      - id: flags
+        type: s4
+      - id: doc
+        type: markdown
+      - id: type_cp_index
+        type: s4
+      - id: length
+        type: s8
+      - id: constant_value
+        type: constant_value
+  constant_value:
+    seq:
+      - id: constant_value_type_cp_index
+        type: s4
+      - id: constant_value_info
+        type:
+          switch-on: type_tag
+          cases:
+            'type_tag_enum::type_tag_int': int_constant_info
+            'type_tag_enum::type_tag_byte': byte_constant_info
+            'type_tag_enum::type_tag_float': float_constant_info
+            'type_tag_enum::type_tag_string': string_constant_info
+            'type_tag_enum::type_tag_decimal': decimal_constant_info
+            'type_tag_enum::type_tag_boolean': boolean_constant_info
+            'type_tag_enum::type_tag_nil': nil_constant_info
+            'type_tag_enum::type_tag_map': map_constant_info
+    instances:
+      type_tag:
+        value: _root.constant_pool.constant_pool_entries[constant_value_type_cp_index].cp_info.as<shape_cp_info>.shape.type_tag
